question_title: Will AAPL's market close price on 2026-02-15 be higher than its market close price on 2026-02-02?
summary: AAPL's short-term price movement over ~10 trading days is close to a coin flip. The base rate for a stock increasing over this period is ~52% due to positive market drift. However, AAPL has negative momentum (-6.5% over 4 weeks) and experienced a "sell the news" pattern after record Q1 2026 earnings on Jan 29. Despite strong fundamentals (23% iPhone revenue growth, earnings beat), the stock fell post-announcement as investors focused on margin guidance concerns. With no major catalysts before Feb 15 and recent downward pressure, I estimate slightly below 50% probability of a higher close.

factors.description: Base rate positive drift: Stock returns have slight positive expected value over 10 trading days (~0.3% expected return)
Recent negative momentum: AAPL down 6.5% over past 4 weeks, suggesting continued selling pressure
Post-earnings selloff pattern: Despite record Q1 earnings on Jan 29, stock fell 1.9% as investors focused on margin concerns
Strong fundamentals: Record revenue ($143.8B), iPhone up 23%, China up 38% - provides underlying support
No near-term catalysts: Next earnings April 30, shareholder meeting Feb 24 (after resolution date)
Analyst targets bullish: Consensus $287 target vs ~$255 current suggests medium-term upside potential
